The influence of sports on society can be positive or negative, depending on the context in which they are played. Sports are not only physically but also mentally beneficial to people of all ages. However, excessive sports participation can have negative effects on mental health. Regular physical activity can lead to an increase in physical symptoms like muscle soreness, and some competitive sports can result in feelings of anxiety, stress, and burnout. It is important to strike a balance between competing demands and prioritize mental health.
